laboratory_examinations.findings: Case 1: TSH of 186.2 mU/liter (upper reference value, 16.9 mU/liter), T4 of 6.5 µg/dl (lower reference value, 9.6 µg/dl). Case 2: TSH of 65.0 mU/liter (upper reference value, 14.3 mU/liter), T4 of 9.7 µg/dl (lower reference value, 21.2 µg/dl).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: In Case 1, TSH levels remained high and T4 values declined over time. Treatment began at 2 months of age for Case 2 when TSH values remained high and T4 values declined.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normotopic, bilobulated gland with low uptake.

laboratory_examinations.date: Age 5 years for Case 1; Age 4 years for Case 2
laboratory_examinations.findings: Case 1 exhibited poor motor skills and slight decline in cognitive tests within normal range. Case 2 showed loss of balance, tremor, hyperreflexia, and marked decline in verbal and motor skills below the normal range.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: In Case 1, a slight decline was observed over the years. Case 2 showed a marked decline in performance at age 4 compared to earlier assessments.
